title: 112_hr2656
content: The Act titled "Pension Technical Modifications Act" allows for the elective exclusion of plan investment expenses when determining target normal cost. The Pension Technical Modifications Act allows for the exclusion of plan investment expenses in determining target normal cost under ERISA and the Internal Revenue Code. The amendments made by the Act will take effect as if included in the Pension Protection Act of 2006. The amendments made by the Pension Technical Modifications Act must be elected within 180 days after the date of such plan year. SEC. 3. DEFINITION OF ELIGIBLE PLAN YEAR. Amendment to ERISA regarding eligible plan years, specifying conditions for a plan to be considered eligible. Amendment to ERISA regarding eligible plan years, specifying conditions for a plan to be considered eligible, including unpaid contributions, liens, and distress termination initiation. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to modify a clause related to pension relief. The amendment specifies conditions for a plan to be considered eligible, including unpaid contributions and the plan sponsor's financial status. The amendment outlines eligibility conditions for a plan, including no outstanding liens, and no distress termination initiated by the plan sponsor. The effective date of the amendments is retroactive to the Preservation of Access to Care for Medicare Beneficiaries and Pension Relief Act of 2010. ELIGIBLE CHARITY PLANS. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 is amended to allow plan sponsors to elect eligible charity plans. The new rules for eligible charity plans must be applied as prescribed by the Secretary of the Treasury. The Pension Protection Act of 2006 is amended to allow plan sponsors to elect eligible charity plans, with the amendments taking effect for plan years beginning after December 31, 2010. SEC. 5. SUSPENSION OF CERTAIN FUNDING LEVEL LIMITATIONS. Limitations on Benefit Accruals under the Worker, Retiree, and Employer Recovery Act of 2008 are amended to extend the period for plan years until December 31, 2011. Adjustments are made to the funding target attainment percentage for the last plan year ending before September 30, 2009. Amendments are made to ERISA and the Internal Revenue Code regarding social security leveling options, ensuring they are not in excess of monthly amounts paid under a single life annuity. The amendments made to ERISA and the Internal Revenue Code apply to annuity payments starting on or after January 1, 2012, with the option for plan sponsors to elect the changes for payments starting during the election period. The provisions of section 203 of the Preservation of Access to Care for Medicare Beneficiaries and Pension Relief Act of 2010 are repealed, and related amendments are removed. Changes are made to ERISA and the Internal Revenue Code for annuity payments starting on or after January 1, 2012, with the option to elect changes for payments starting during the election period. Amendment to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 changes the date from September 1, 2011, to January 1, 2012.
